sources.title: "A Child Of The Ghetto" (1910) director D. W. Griffith
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems   "A Child of the Ghetto" is a short drama. The film is included in our program to illustrate the work of Billy Bitzer, a star of Silent Hall of Fame. A girl escapes from town after being accused of theft. Later she meets one of her chasers. Directed by                          D.W. Griffith Produced by                        Biograph Company Scenario by                          Stanner E.V. Taylor Cinematography                G.W. metadata.Plot: After her mother's death, Ruth struggles to support herself as a seamstress. While Ruth delivers shirts to the factory owner, the owner's son steals some money and Ruth is accused of the crime. She flees the ghetto of New York's Lower East Side and hides in the country where a young farmer takes her in and they fall in love.
metadata.Actors: Dorothy West, Kate Bruce, Dell Henderson
